data.title: Lines are worth it
data.text: There's always a line, but well worth the wait. The ice cream is absolutely delicious. The one scoop is humongous. The waffle cones are excellent. The employees are happy to serve, and seem to enjoy their work.

data.title: Best ice cream in new haven
data.text: Stopped in with a large group for desert after dining out. 5 out of 6 got the ice cream and were not disappointed. The toasted almond is out of this world. Those are some happy Litchfield cows that make that divine ice cream. They had a good amount of flavors but not so many that your head spins. You can als but farmers cheese and a few other dairy products. I only live a short drive away from the actual Arethisa farm but had never gone there. This ended a great night out in New Haven.

data.title: THE BEST!
data.text:
I LOVE ice cream....not only is this dairy farm the best, but it is
a bargain and getting very popular now that the Yalies are BACK!
A good size cone in a waffle cone is a BARGAIN and yummy!  The
help is accommodating and happy to serve.  Some will say not enough choice in flavors, but I LOVE it!  They also make grilled
cheese and milkshakes.  Sell cheeses, yogurt and milk also!
Could eat the ice cream for dinner every nite!

data.title: Ice Cream Stop
data.text: Old fashioned ice cream parlor feel and delicious ice cream. We had coconut/chocolate chip and it was lovely. Lines moved fast. A nice place to stop for a break on a hot day.

data.title: very tasty and really reasonably priced
data.text:
first, i have to say that i wish the Average rating actually said Good. Arethusa is good, but does not quite hit very good in my book -- or i should say my husband's book -- as this trip to Arethusa was for him. he is the ice cream guy in this family. 

yes, the portions are quite generous. 
yes, the price point is great. they don't have to buy the milk so there is a huge saving that is passed on to the consumer.
yes, the line moves quickly and the place is really clean and smells wonderful.

but, the quintessential vanilla is sorely lacking for body and character. it was kind of flat and dull. not the big vanilla flavor my husband was hoping for. to my palate the taste was kind of watery and muted.

major high fives and applause to the strawberry. big succulent pieces of strawberry throughout the strawberry portion of his two flavor small cone. the strawberry alone made this ice cream worth the trip from central Connecticut -- plus it was a gorgeous day for motorcycle riding and we were able to scoop up a parking space for our bikes across the street and a few spaces down. just right!

we will go back before the strawberries are gone for the year.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: The Ice Cream was great, and very fresh. They also had other dairy products such as cheese and milk. Another person in my party was annoyed that there were no toppings, but I don't think it mattered much.

data.title: Stop in for the Ice Cream
data.text: The Yale tour folks told us we "had to" come here for the ice cream, and it was an excellent decision to do so. I was in the mood for a shake, and I asked the scooper what he'd recommend. He said he'd been experimenting with combos and he liked peach & strawberry together...I agreed to try it. He asked if I wanted "skim or whole milk?" This is REAL ice cream, folks, and therefore, deserves real milk in the shake! In a word, DELICIOUS and the best milkshake I've ever had. Go now!

data.title: Big scoops!
data.text: Everybody from New Haven talks this is place all visitors should visit. I really like going to this place when I have a mood for sth sweet. For me strawberry flavour is the best. For the first time in my life I can't eat all scoop!

data.title: The best
data.text: We have been eager travelers to the northwest CT location since it opened every weekend during the summer, so what a treat that it opens within a 10 minute drive. No more trips to Litchfield County for Ice Cream. The best is in New Haven. And the butter and cheese are tremendous too. get the waffle cone. can't wait for peach to come into season.

data.title: The perfect scoop!
data.text: We've popped our head in this attractive storefront on Chapel Street a few times since it opened. But on this hot summer's evening, we were ready to stop in and partake. While the menu offered a limited number of ice cream flavors (nine or ten at most), my friends and I enjoyed absolutely delicious treats. I loved my coconut ice cream with dark chocolate chips. My friends enjoyed a chocolate shake (he said it was among the best he's ever had), a cherry dark chocolate chunk and a almond coconut. The 'one scoop' in a cup or cone is a very generous portion. So glad we finally sampled!

data.title: Amazing ice creams and GINORMOUS portions
data.text:
About 10 favors - all made at their Dairy....
Authentic product . Portions are huge. One scoop - yes one scoop - is about a pint !!!!
If you order a waffle cone, you can share with 3 people !!

data.title: Amazing ice cream
data.text: Arethusa offers a selection of sandwiches, local cheeses, and dairy items.  The milk and yogurt are great.  The coffee milk is not overly sweet and tasty. But the reason you go is to get a freshly made waffle cone with scoops of delicious ice cream the size of softballs.  We have been stopping in weekly, our favorite flavors are mint chip, coffee, chocolate and strawberry. The shakes are also great and staff suggested chocolate/coffee (chocolate ice cream with coffee milk).

data.title: You MUST go here for ice cream!
data.text: Read lots of great reviews on other websites and decided to come here with my husband on a warm sunny summer day.  It's a small shopfront that sells local dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt) as well as coffee and sometimes bagels.  We came for the ice cream, and when we arrived there were already several families eating huge cones outside and a line wrapping around the store (it goes fast).  As others have said, there are few but excellent flavors, this is some of the best ice cream I've ever had, and the portions are very generous.  Try it, you won't regret it!

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: We brought our family of four here for an after-dinner ice cream during a visit to a student at Yale.  Quality is exceptional, flavors unique and special, and portions extremely generous.  Waffle cones are a highlight and a terrific bargain. Highly recommended.

data.title: Best Rum Raisin ice cream!
data.text:
Nice selection of farm fresh homemade ice cream and cheeses. 
Staff very friendly and encourage you to try different varieties.

data.title: BEST ice cream in New Haven
data.text: Arethusa is a little shop that sells ice cream, cheese and milk. The ice cream is the best there is in New Haven and servings extremely generous. A waffle cone with a HUGE scoop, big enough to be divided into two flavors, is only $3.50 and worth every penny. There aren't as many flavors as some other places but the quality is so high that what they do have is all good. We especially like the the toasted almond with toasted coconut, coffee, rum raisin and black cherry chocolate, but everything we've had has been terrific! The waffle cones are freshly made behind the counter and the store is fairly small so expect a line but the staff is friendly and the line moves pretty fast.
